articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: I like David Turnbull, when given a chance, he does a job for Celtic and he has a role to play in this season’s title race.  But talk about AC Milan being interested in him is surely fanciful.  Scots have done well in Italy recently, David could thrive there, but the demands at Milan would [...]
articles.title: Historic Vatican visit represents us all

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: LIAM SCALES played his seventeenth first-team game this season in Celtic’s 2-0 loss against Lazio in Rome. The Republic of Ireland international defender has been involved in every minute of the team’s ill-fated Champions League crusade which started in Rotterdam, moved to Parkhead against the Serie A outfit and then the double-header against Atletico Madrid. [...]
articles.title: FOUL PLAY: LIAM SCALES’ BRUTAL LEARNING CURVE

articles.author: CQN Magazine
articles.description: IT LOOKS as though David Turnbull’s days as a Celtic player are numbered after a series of snubs from Brendan Rodgers. The latest came in the midweek Champions League exit to Lazio in Rome when the Hoops boss again elected to start with on-loan Benfica midfielder Paulo Bernardo. Turnbull, a £2.75million recruit by Neil Lennon [...]

articles.description: TODAY marks the 26th anniversary of a significant silverware success that is almost overshadowed in Celtic history. articles.description: JOE HART dismissed a personal milestone to focus on the disappointment of the 2-0 defeat to Lazio in Rome. However, the record sequence was not on Hart’s mind after the Hoops’ loss meant there would be [...]

articles.description: BRENDAN RODGERS praised his players for their “effort and commitment”, despite the 2-0 loss to Lazio in Rome firing Celtic into Euro oblivion for another season. The Hoops conceded two late goals in another disappointing collapse in the Champions League – their fourth in five games – to make the final Group E match against [...]

articles.author: Paul67
articles.description: Midway through the second half, I chastised myself for being so downbeat about our prospects last night.  For 81 minutes, the game was there to be won.  Neither team was at full strength, but if Celtic had a little of Maeda’s industry, or Hatate’s control, the outcome could have been different. As it was, the [...]

The ball was worked to Kyogo Furuhashi in the middle of the pitch [...]
